newsitem.title: ITALY: Italy trade data points to economic pick-up - Istat.
newsitem.headline: Italy trade data points to economic pick-up - Istat.

text.p: Data showing an increase in both Italy's imports and exports in May suggested that firms believe an economic recovery is on the way, said Mario Gaggiotti, who compiles trade data for national statistics office Istat.
Istat said earlier on Tuesday that exports rose 3.6 percent year-on-year in May while imports climbed 7.4 percent.
"One hypothesis to explain this is that companies have more faith in the economic pick-up and are therefore buying goods from abroad for production," Gaggiotti told reporters.
"The data is quite positive," he added.

Turning to trade figures with European Union countries for April, also released earlier on Tuesday, Gaggiotti said the strong increase in both imports and exports was partially explained by the fact Easter this year fell in March while last year it came in April.
EU imports rose 14 percent year-on-year in April, while exports climbed 10.3 percent.
